intro: Anemone narcissiflora var. willdenowii, commonly known as the willdenow's anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often with a contrasting central area. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped, palmately lobed leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is closely related to the common anemone, sharing similar botanical characteristics and ecological preferences.
